channel.title: Precalculus help
channel.description:
Alright, so my teacher gave us this problem the other day, and I thought I had it figured out. Then he decided to tell us that there are 2 possible answers for it, and we needed both.
"The pattern pictured below is a piece of cardboard that will be folded into a rectangular box with two square sides. The surface area of the cut cardboard is 1400 in². The volume of the box is 3000 in³. What are the dimensions of the box?"
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/UNqEo.png[/img]
The dimensions of the box that I got were length = 30, width & height = 10. My process: Knowing w = h, volume = lw², so 3000 = lw², 3000/w² = l. 1400 = 2(2lw + w²) 700 = 2lw + w² w² + 2lw - 700 = 0 w² + 2w(3000/w²) - 700 = 0 Graph that, then find out what y is when x = 0, where x = w. when y = 0, x = 10, so w = 10, h = 10. 3000/10² = l, 30 = l.
So ya, how do I get the other solution? (Yes I know, I am bad at math.)
Edit: The only possibility I can think of, is that the graphed function crosses the x axis at 0 twice, but one is negative, which would give me an extraneous solution.
Edit again: My typing has become terrible and I can't seem to get my thoughts across correctly...

item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled

item.title: Precalculus help
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

Alright, so my teacher gave us this problem the other day, and I thought I had it figured out. Then he decided to tell us that there are 2 possible answers for it, and we needed both.

“The pattern pictured below is a piece of cardboard that will be folded into a rectangular box with two square sides. The surface area of the cut cardboard is 1400 in². The volume of the box is 3000 in³. What are the dimensions of the box?”

UNqEo.png707×374

The dimensions of the box that I got were length = 30, width & height = 10. My process:
Knowing w = h, volume = lw², so 3000 = lw², 3000/w² = l.
1400 = 2(2lw + w²)
700 = 2lw + w²
w² + 2lw - 700 = 0
w² + 2w(3000/w²) - 700 = 0
Graph that, then find out what y is when x = 0, where x = w.
when y = 0, x = 10, so w = 10, h = 10.
3000/10² = l, 30 = l.

So ya, how do I get the other solution? (Yes I know, I am bad at math.)

Edit:
The only possibility I can think of, is that the graphed function crosses the x axis at 0 twice, but one is negative, which would give me an extraneous solution.

Edit again:
My typing has become terrible and I can’t seem to get my thoughts across correctly…
